heading: Is long-term unemployment a real issue in the EU?
subheading: In 2023, an average of 2.1% of the working population of the 27 member states was affected by long-term unemployment.  This represents a fall of 32% compared to 2018 (3.1%).
textNote: The long-term unemployment rate is the percentage of the working population aged between 15 and 74 who have been unemployed for 12 months or more.
